title: Ticket #5793: Problem with default JOB_DEFAULT_REQUESTMEMORY
description:
Reported by Stuart via Tom to Condor ticket system.

The default setting of JOB_DEFAULT_REQUESTMEMORY, ifThenElse(MemoryUsage ! UNDEFINED,MemoryUsage,(ImageSize+1023)/1024) appears to be problematic for jobs submitted without RequestMemory under HTCondor 8.4.7 and Partitionable slots if they are preempted and need to match/run again. In particular, I noticed that a number of jobs in the LIGO CIT SL7.2 pool that where relying on this default where being rejected by partitionable slot STARTD’s with, 

07/09/16 15:07:44 slot1_3: New machine resource of type -1 allocated
07/09/16 15:07:44 Setting up slot pairings
07/09/16 15:07:44 slot1_3: Slot requirements not satisfied.
07/09/16 15:07:44 slot1_3: Job ad was ============================
However, if I condor_qedit RequestMemory to be quantize(ImageSize/1024,1) then jobs are not rejected and start in a dynamic slot.

I believe there are a few problems:

0) Sec 3.5.1.19 states a different default default value, http://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/manual/v8.4/3_5Policy_Configuration.html#37135 

JOB_DEFAULT_REQUESTMEMORY = ifThenElse(MemoryUsage =!= UNDEFINED, MemoryUsage, 1)
then what I observe and what is stated in Sec 3.3.13, http://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/manual/v8.4/3_3Configuration.html#25623 
ifThenElse(MemoryUsage =!= UNDEFINED,MemoryUsage,(ImageSize+1023)/1024)
1) It looks like RequestMemory must be an integer to be effective. I first tried manually calculating a reasonable RequestMemory value for a test job and entered that via condor_qedit as a real number. However, even when I seriously inflated the value STARTD for the partitionable slot would still reject the job until I rounded that to an integer.

2) Even with STARTD_DEBUG = D_ALL I was unable to find a mention in StartLog of what “Slot requirements” where not satisfied. I think it would be very helpful to log this and make it easy to access, e.g., from a submit machine I would love to see “condor_q -better-analyze JobId” report details on the last failed attempt to start a job (if there was a match that was rejected).

3) Attempting to use the ResidentSetSize directly (or via MemoryUsage) in RequestMemory did not work (even after rounding to an integer). I did not investigate this very much, but I believe startd is not happy if RequestMemory is less than ImageSize.

At any rate, the following was successful in getting a number of otherwise idle jobs running,

A) Make a list of idle jobs requesting less memory than ImageSize before and after running qedit, 

condor_q -constraint "(jobstatus == 1) && (RequestMemory < ImageSize/1024)" -af globaljobid RequestMemory ImageSize/1024

B) Set all of those jobs to track their ImageSize, 

condor_qedit -constraint "(jobstatus == 1) && (RequestMemory < ImageSize/1024)" RequestMemory "quantize(ImageSize/1024,1)"
C) Change the default setting for new user jobs being submitted, 
[root@ldas-pcdev2 ~]# cat /etc/condor/config.d/memory
JOB_DEFAULT_REQUESTMEMORY = quantize(ImageSize/1024,1)
